intro: Columnea dielsii, commonly known as the Diels' flame bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. Columnea dielsii thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
